sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the negated 1st person plural communis pronoun.

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: This is used for the 1.p.pl. masculine
This is used for the 1.p.pl. masculine
This is used for the 1.p.pl. masculine
This is used for the 1.p.pl. feminine
This is used for the 1.p.pl. feminine
The most common way to negate the pronouns is through the prefix mu(u)b (Qafisheh 1977:243)
There are no negative forms of the pronouns themselves, instead the pronouns are negated with muš preceding the pronoun.
There are no negative forms of the pronouns themselves, instead the pronouns are negated with maš or miš preceding the pronoun.
